contents.label: title
contents.text: Suggested Format for a Written Hazard Communication Program

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: B.. All labels shall be checked for：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Change from MSDS to SDS format effective June 1， 2015- Chemical manufacturers or importers shall ensure that SDSs for their products includes the following Sections in order：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: B. Before their initial work assignment， each new employee will receive hazard communication training. This will include the following information and training：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: C. The employee shall be informed that：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Hazardous Non-routine Tasks (Delete section if not applicable.)

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: A. Occasionally， employees are required to perform non-routine tasks (i.e.， clean reactor vessels， enter confined spaces， etc.). Prior to starting work in such areas， each employee will be given information about the hazards of the area or procedure. This information will include：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Measures the company has taken to eliminate or control the hazard， including：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: A. If our company exposes any employee of another employer to any hazardous chemicals that we produce， use， or store， the following information will be supplied to that employer：
